required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Varenicline and Lorcaserin for Smoking Cessation and Weight Gain Prevention

brief_summary.textblock: Some individuals smoke with the perception that smoking helps control body weight. Smokers gain an average of as much as 10 pounds in the months following smoking abstinence, with heavier and more-dependent smokers gaining more weight. T The Mayo Clinic Nicotine Research Program will randomize 100 nondiabetic, overweight or obese adult smokers to active lorcaserin or placebo for 24 weeks; all of the subjects will receive open-label varenicline for 12 weeks. The purpose of this study is to assess the efficacy of a 24-week course of lorcaserin for decreasing weight gain after stopping smoking.

primary_outcome.description: weight (kg) change from baseline to week 24 among subjects who meet criteria for prolonged smoking abstinence at week 24

secondary_outcome.description: BMI change from baseline to week 24
Lorcaserin combined with open label varenicline will be evaluated for improved smoking abstinence compared to placebo
Waist Circumference change from baseline to week 24
Body Fat difference from baseline to week 24.

arm_group.description: Subjects will receive open label varenicline (12 weeks) plus a placebo for lorcaserin (24 weeks)
Subjects will receive open label varenicline (12 weeks) plus lorcaserin (24 weeks)

intervention.description: lorcaserin is an FDA-approved weight loss medication for overweight and obese patients
Chantix is an FDA approved medication for smoking cessation

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Recruitment took place between June 16th, 2016 to January 22nd, 2020. Recruitment was in three phases: initial phone pre-screen, followed by a consent visit and study screen, and finally a randomization visit. All visits took place at a medical clinic.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
